turns.user_input: Emma has this big science project due on Friday and she's been procrastinating

expected_behavior.response: acknowledge concern, ask about the project or how user can help
expected_behavior.notes_should_capture: Emma - science project, due Friday, procrastinating

model_response_raw.response: Oh no, that sounds stressful for Emma! It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed when a big project is looming, especially with procrastination adding to the pressure.  Has she talked about what's making it hard to start?

user_response.text: Oh no, that sounds stressful for Emma! It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed when a big project is looming, especially with procrastination adding to the pressure.  Has she talked about what's making it hard to start?

turns.user_input: It's about volcanoes. She needs to build a model and write a report. I'm worried she won't finish in time.

expected_behavior.response: empathize with worry, maybe suggest breaking it down or timeline
expected_behavior.notes_should_capture: Emma's project: volcanoes, model + report required

model_response_raw.response: A volcano model and report, wow! That's a substantial project. It's natural to feel worried when you see her struggling with it, especially with the deadline so close.  Sometimes breaking down a big task like that can make it feel more manageable. Have you two thought about how to tackle the model versus the report first?

user_response.text: A volcano model and report, wow! That's a substantial project. It's natural to feel worried when you see her struggling with it, especially with the deadline so close.  Sometimes breaking down a big task like that can make it feel more manageable. Have you two thought about how to tackle the model versus the report first?

internal_notes.observations: {"emma_project_due_date":"Friday","emma_project_status":"procrastinating","emma_project_details":{"topic":"volcanoes","components":["model building","report writing"]},"user_concern":"Emma won't finish in time"}

turns.user_input: Jake is doing better in school actually. His reading improved a lot since we started doing 20 minutes every night.

expected_behavior.response: celebrate Jake's progress, acknowledge the effort
expected_behavior.notes_should_capture: Jake - reading improved, 20 min nightly reading routine working

model_response_raw.response: That's wonderful to hear about Jake! Consistency really pays off, and it sounds like those 20 minutes every night are making a huge difference in his reading. What a great accomplishment for him, and for you both!

progress.notes: Reading improved significantly since starting this routine.

user_response.text: That's wonderful to hear about Jake! Consistency really pays off, and it sounds like those 20 minutes every night are making a huge difference in his reading. What a great accomplishment for him, and for you both!

turns.user_input: Can you help me track both kids' school stuff? Like a family notes thing?

expected_behavior.response: offer to create a family notes artifact

children.name: Jake
wins: reading improved with 20 min nightly practice

internal_notes.user_request: track both kids' school stuff as family notes

model_response_raw.response: Absolutely! Creating a shared family notes space for their schoolwork sounds like a great idea to keep everything organized. We can make sure to capture both Emma's volcano project and Jake's reading progress. What should we title this family notes artifact?

user_response.text: Absolutely! Creating a shared family notes space for their schoolwork sounds like a great idea to keep everything organized. We can make sure to capture both Emma's volcano project and Jake's reading progress. What should we title this family notes artifact?

expected_behavior.response: note the addition, update the artifact

model_response_raw.response: Thanks for adding that! It's good to keep all of Emma's commitments in mind. So, she's got the volcano project due Friday and a soccer game on Saturday morning. That's quite a busy week for her!
